page.title: 19PUB LIFE IN SHROTON
page.content: { THE WHITE HART}IS CENTRAL IN THE VILLAGE. IT IS VERY QUIET MOST LUNCHTIMES AND OFTEN ON WEEKDAY EVENINGS THOUGH ALWAYS OPEN BUT IT IS BUSY AT WEEKENDS AND CAN BE PACKED WITH 70-80 PEOPLE AT SUNDAY LUNCHTIME. A TUESDAY EVENING - THE CAR PARK IS PARTLY FILLED BY CARS AND VANS. LIGHTS AND VOICES COME FROM THE DOOR MARKED SALOON. INSIDE THE CHAIRS AND TABLES ARE EMPTY, EVERYONE IS STANDING BY THE BAR OR CLUSTERED AROUND THE POOL TABLE WHERE A MATCH AGAINST ANOTHER PUB IS IN PROGRESS. GOOD NATURED BANTER IS AIMED AT PLAYERS, OTHER CONVERSATIONS ON CRICKET, WEATHER, CARS AND A VISIT TO FRANCE GO ON IN THE BACKGROUND. THE PUBLICAN IS FAIRLY BUSY REFILLING PINTS OF BEER. THE RESIDENT CAT SITS ON A BAR STOOL. AT 10 PM. HUNKS OF BREAD, CHEESE AND PICKLED ONIONS APPEAR.
